verbose_text: A lectin microarray analysis showed the differential expression of alpha2 6sialylated and alpha2 3sialylated O-glycan glycans during cellular senescence between elderly- (86-year old and 97-year old subjects) versus fetus derived human skin diploid fibroblast cells.138 In contrast to those membrane glycoproteins that decrease with age, alpha2-3/2-6sialylated intracellular glycoproteins, except for some alpha2 3sialylated O-glycans, increase with age.107 Lectin microarrays coupled with LC-MS of plasma proteins from Japanese semi-supercentenarians (106-109 years), aged controls (70-88 years), and young controls (20-38 years) revealed increased binding to ECA lectins.
